page.title: 07Banwell Carnival Week
page.content: Since 1978 a Carnival has been held during the last week in July. Annual events are the family sports evening, the boat race and a procession on the last day. The River Banwell is dammed to raise its depth for the boat race. Children, and adults, spend hours planning and building their rafts (usually oil drums and planks) for the big day. The race is as much fun for the spectators as it is for the entrants, some of the audience becoming as wet as the "sailors". The procession on Saturday is led by the Carnival Princess and her attendants, chosen from the village girls under 16. Local families or clubs enter floats, or walk in fancy dress through the village to the recreation field where there are many stalls and fairground entertainments.
